meta_description: History comes alive in the Columbia River Gorge at the Columbia River Gorge Museum.
admission_text:
# Swing into Valentine's Day

Sat, Feb 14

| 

Stevenson

Dance lesson, dancing, wine, food, sweets in a romantic setting. For singles or couples!

## Time & Location

Feb 14, 2026, 6:00 PM – 10:00 PM

Stevenson, 990 SW Rock Creek Dr, Stevenson, WA 98648, USA

## Guests

\+ 18 other guests

## About the event

Come as a single or couple and enjoy a fun, delicious, Valentine's Day with wine, food, sweets, a dance lesson and swing the night away. 

Show More

## Immerse yourself in the rich and diverse history, stories, culture, and people of the Columbia River Gorge.

[Become A Member](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/copy-of-become-a-member-1)

# COLUMBIA GORGE MUSEUM

## WINTER HOURS: 10 AM TO 4 PM  
THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY  
  
**CLOSED MON-TUES-WED**

[Make A Donation ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/donate)

[Explore ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org)

## Exhibitions and Events

Exhibitions

Humberto Gonález: Veiled Beauty

Open Dec. 19th to February 22nd

[DETAILS ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/humberto)

SVETOZAR: The Early Life of Baron Eugene Fersen

Open Summer through Winter seasons

​

[DETAILS ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/svetozar-the-early-life-of-baron-eugene-fersen)

Illustrating Ecosystems: Native Turtles and Plants of the Gorge

Open Summer through Winter seasons

​

[DETAILS ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/illustrating-ecosystems)

The Art & Science of Flintknapping

In the Emory and Ruth Strong Library

[DETAILS ](https://www.columbiagorgemuseum.org/the-art-and-science-of-flint-knapping)
